intro: Carex oederi subsp. oedocarpa, commonly known as the broad-leaf sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia and North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, rushes, and other grass-like plants. This subspecies is characterized by its wide, flat leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of brown flowers. It typically grows in moist or wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. The plant is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and filter water.
